metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Valeria in Sharess Caress.She is very dismissive no matter what you found in Open Hand temple.
metadata.how_to_trigger: goto > Act3 > WYR > Start goto -44; 46; -4talk to Valeriagoto 23; 47; 91talk to Valeria again

73.speaker: Valeria
73.text: I presume you've found something interesting to discuss, if you're interrupting me again?
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gives a hearty laugh and then drinksNodeContext: They are emphasizing the "ah" of "valeria" to make it rhyme with huzzah - very very drunk

98.speaker: Valeria
98.text: One more for the road and I'll get to it. Wyrm's Crossing... Blasted place...
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gives a hearty laugh and then drinksNodeContext: They are emphasizing the "ah" of "valeria" to make it rhyme with huzzah - very very drunk

99.speaker: Valeria
99.text: Another case closed, another bottle open! Huzzah to Valeri-AH!
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gives a hearty laugh and then drinksNodeContext: They are emphasizing the "ah" of "valeria" to make it rhyme with huzzah - very very drunk

17.speaker: Valeria
17.text: Hang on a tick, I recognise that face. You were talking to Yannis after I left the temple, I'll bet she's put you up to something.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

44.speaker: Player
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

6.speaker: Valeria
6.text: Well, you won't get a sip for free, I insist you work for it.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

66.speaker: Valeria
66.text: Propose a toast, and if it's worth drinking to, that is what we shall do.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I'll toast you when we actually solve Father Lorgan's murder. Together.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

3.speaker: Valeria
3.text: Why must you busybodies insist on interrupting a perfectly good night of...
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria trails off as they look at the player intensely

78.speaker: Valeria
78.text: You remind me of Devella. Fine - if you doubt my conclusions, out with it. What have you found?

12.speaker: Valeria
12.text: My assistant. She's posted in the Lower City investigating Duke Stelmane's murder. Now, back to it - what have you found?

82.speaker: Valeria
82.text: Gods. Stelmane is really gone, then.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: Gods. Stelmane is really gone, then.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Father Lorgan's murder is just one part of a bigger plot, a Bhaal plot.

79.speaker: Valeria
79.text: A Bhaal plot? You as well?

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I found the murder weapon you missed in a tunnel under the temple.

10.speaker: Valeria
10.text: That's quite the discovery. Doesn't tell me everything, though. Why was Lorgan killed?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I assume for the same reason as all the other people on the target list - to gain Bhaal's favour.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Maybe he gave really boring sermons.

22.speaker: Valeria
22.text: 'Maybe' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.

18.speaker: Valeria
18.text: Come back when you've got some real evidence.

38.speaker: Valeria
38.text: You want to know why he was murdered? Bhaal.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You want to know why he was murdered? Bhaal.

63.speaker: Valeria
63.text: Devella's been harping on about Bhaal for months. Fancies herself something of an expert.

81.speaker: Valeria
81.text: I assumed it was just a bunch of conspiracy codswallop and fearmongering, but she's been unusually insistent about this one, even for her.

43.speaker: Valeria
43.text: Ugh, fine. I'll bite. What's your theory?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: It's not a theory - I have proof. This document contains information connecting the murders to the Bhaalist resurgence.

2.speaker: Valeria
2.text: No need to wave documents at me. I'm already drowning in paperwork as it is.

13.speaker: Valeria
13.text: Constable Devella is going to be a real pain in the trunk about this.

55.speaker: Valeria
55.text: Since you seem to be on an obnoxiously similar wavelength, why don't you seek her out. She'll be at the Elfsong Tavern. Show her the list, and I'll stay and inform the Fist here.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gestures implying giving something to player off-screen

1.speaker: Valeria
1.text: Oh and you'll need this pass - it'll give you access to the Lower City.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria gestures implying giving something to player off-screen

94.speaker: Valeria
94.text: Well? What are you waiting for? You've a bloody conspiracy to solve - move!
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria drinks again, then speaks.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Father Bhaal is letting his children out to play. His acolytes are out running red and rampant.

24.speaker: Valeria
24.text: Well if that's true, that sounds dreadful. And complicated.

54.speaker: Valeria
54.text: As if this cult of the Absolute wasn't enough to worry about...

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Bhaal's recruiting initiates to his cult. Committing murder is how they receive an invite.
42.context: NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I reserve judgement until I undertake further investigation.
25.context: NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

71.speaker: Valeria
71.text: What is it with you young people and this need to investigate everything.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Why should I tell you? Doesn't sound like you even care.
23.context: NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

36.speaker: Valeria
36.text: Well that's just insulting. I am an Investigator, you know. But I'm off the clock... and this is Devella's pet project...
36.context: NodeContext: 'But I'm off the clock...' pondering an opportunity to make the player do the work leaving her to get back to her drinking

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Isn't it your job to come up with the theories?

14.speaker: Valeria
14.text: I'm off the clock. But this is Devella's pet project...

86.speaker: Player
86.text: If you want motive, perhaps you should look for it. Preferably not at the bottom of a bottle.

19.speaker: Valeria
19.text: And if you want to offload your judgement, I suggest you find someone else to bother.

101.speaker: Valeria
101.text: Until you have something useful to say, leave me to my bottle. It's better company than you are, that's for sure.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I don't have anything for you.

69.speaker: Valeria
69.text: Look, if you find something definitive, come back. Until then, leave me to my drink.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Could be to do with how he was helping the refugees.

49.speaker: Valeria
49.text: 'Could' doesn't quite cut it here, I'm afraid. I need a solid, provable motive.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: How about the shapeshifting assassins under the temple? That good enough?

84.speaker: Valeria
84.text: No. I want proof. If someone else killed Lorgan, I want you to tell me why they did it.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I spoke to both corpses. They were killed by a dwarf dressed in red.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I spoke with Father Lorgan's corpse. He was killed by a dwarf dressed in red, not Brilgor.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I spoke to Brilgor's spirit. A red-clad dwarf killed them both.

68.speaker: Valeria
68.text: That doesn't make sense. Why would this dwarf kill Father Lorgan? I need something more than vague allegations.

16.speaker: Valeria
16.text: Look, I appreciate the 'amateur investigator' act. It's oddly flattering, with emphasis on the 'odd'. But without hard evidence and an alternate motive, I consider this case closed.

64.speaker: Valeria
64.text: I want something compelling. Hard, tangible evidence, and nothing less.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I found another body in the Flophouse nearby. I think it's related.

39.speaker: Valeria
39.text: You're telling me more than one person has been killed? In Baldur's Gate? You must have something better than that.

74.speaker: Valeria
74.text: I need proof. Hard proof. A motive too - otherwise I'm afraid the case remains closed.

87.speaker: Valeria
87.text: I need hard evidence and a motive. Why would someone else kill Lorgan? How can we be sure it wasn't Brilgor?

80.speaker: Player
80.text: A group of shapeshifting assassins were under the temple. Along with more murder victims.

52.speaker: Valeria
52.text: While that is startling, it still doesn't disprove my theory that Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, does it?

35.speaker: Valeria
35.text: That's what you need if you want to change my mind. Hard evidence. A reason, too, if you're at it. Why was Lorgan killed?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I haven't found anything of note.

95.speaker: Valeria
95.text: It was the height of arrogance, then, to disturb me. Don't come back unless you've got something worth saying.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: To lazy conclusions, and even lazier detectives!
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

77.speaker: Valeria
77.text: A tad cliché, but I've drunk to worse. To adventure, and all the dull investigation work it leaves in its wake.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

53.speaker: Valeria
53.text: A tad cliché, but I've drunk to worse. To adventure, and all the dull investigation work it leaves in its wake.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

47.speaker: Valeria
47.text: Now scram - I'm about to become terrible company.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Valeria and the player take a drink.

88.text: That's the worst thing I've seen all month, and I poke around corpses for a living.

40.speaker: Valeria
40.text: That's the worst thing I've seen all month, and I poke around corpses for a living.

7.speaker: Valeria
7.text: Now get out of here before you embarrass yourself further.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I've changed my mind, keep your booze.

96.speaker: Valeria
96.text: I will. And you can keep that snooty attitude, I want none of it.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Afraid so - I've found new evidence, Investigator.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: She asked me to find Lorgan's real killer, seeing as you can't be bothered.
